text:
Coronation Service

Photo-News Dept.
American Press Assn.
225 W. 39th St., N.Y.C.

A feature of the coronation festivities immediately preceding the great event itself was the great woman's suffrage parade, called "seven miles of marching women." The procession consisted of floats, women dressed in historic costume, etc.
The picture shows Miss Anna B-  Joan of Arc.
Photo copyright 1911 by American Press Assn.
title: Woman suffrage - [Coronation festivities - Showing a woman dressed in historic costume of Joan of Arc.]

text:
'Aug. 24, 1912
Olympic Heroes Honored

New York to-day paid it's tribute to the men who carried the Stars & Stripes to victory in the track & field events at Stockholm. It was the greatest athletic demonstration ever held in the city.
The Swedish societies, of New York, turned out in force to do honor the conquerors. The women dressed in native added much to the attractiveness of the spectacle.

Photo-News Dept.
American Press Assn.
225-229 W. 39th St., N.Y.
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - [Olympic heroes honored.]

text:
PARADES 1912

Aug. 24, 1912

OLYMPIC HEROES HONORED

New York to-day paid its tribute to the men who carried the Stars and Stripes to victory in the track and field events at Stockholm. It was the greatest athletic demonstration ever held in the city.

The Swedish societies, of New York, turned out in force to do honor the conquerors. The women dressed in native added much to the attractiveness of the spectacle.

Photo News Dept.,
225 West 39th St.
American Press Ass'n,
New York City
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - [Olympic heroes honored.]

text:
May 6, 1912

While it is impossible to ascertain who was the oldest suffragist who marched or rode in the great Suffragist demonstration on Saturday in New York, there was no trouble in finding out who carried off the palm as the youngest. The little suffragist in the picture had the honor of leading a division of the parade.

Photo-News Dept.
American Press Assn.
225 W. 39th St., N.Y.C.

(C) 1912 American Press Assn.

2 Neg. # 202
title: Woman suffrage - [The little suffragist had the honor of leading a division of the parade.]
